surgically, she will die.
• Do a midline (up-and-down) incision in the abdomen, as there may be other unexpected pathology. A transverse
incision allows very limited exposure and should only be used for elective surgery or if the site of the ectopic
pregnancy can be clearly identified on ultrasound.
• Be careful not to damage the bowel when opening the peritoneum as the bowel will be pushed against the
peritoneum by the blood clots in the abdomen.
• Use a large suction and your hand to remove
